mdRecord.dcterms:title: Letter: Lund Washington to George Washington, 1778 March 4
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Washington, Lund, 1737-1796
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Covering horse arrived -- bond signed with Triplett for land below mill race -- Robert Adam paid account -- "I have a great mind to put the Money into the Continental Loan office, but perhaps it would be proper to get your approbation first" -- Mrs. Mary Washington wants Silla sent to her, but Lund hates to part her from Jack -- Charles Washington wrote for another hand but he didn't send one -- tobacco land to be put to flax -- pumpkin to be planted -- persimmons for beer and spirits -- mare sent by Col. Lewis sick -- Lund's lip still sore. Autograph letter signed, 2 pages, integral cover, laminated, docketed by George Washington, watermark (CD surmounted by bell and fleur-de lis).
